A comparison of the numbers shown under V. for the 7 months does fore give an accurate criterion of the vessels in Allied service at the different periods. (15 Including 19 vessels formerly shown under separate heading " Trading for Colonies." fif "Requisition" is here used to mean "requisition for full Government service." The vessels shown as "free from requisition " include the vessels that are requisitioned under the special liner requisitioning scheme, under which vessels, while running for Government are run by their owners and accept some private cargo. All liner trades are being requisitioned under special conditions, which, while leaving the vessels still under the management of their owners, and free to accept private as well as Government cargo, secure the profits to the Government, the owners being paid on a Blue Book basis. General requisitions have been served oa the fo'lowing lines, but the individual vessels only come gradually under the requisition as they arrive in the United Kingdom, er other specified place of discharge.\ These were formerly included in a separate main heading VI., on page 2.Aberdeen Line . - -Allan Line.Anchor Line.Asiatic S.N.
